results.title: Double indemnity (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Joseph Sistrom and Billy Wilder
results.brief_description: Archetypal film noir of the forties, brilliantly filmed and incisively written by Billy Wilder and Raymond Chandler, perfectly capturing the decayed Los Angeles atmosphere of a Chandler novel but using a simpler story and more substantial characters. The hero/villain was almost a new concept. Stars Fred MacMurray, Barbara Stanwyck and Edward G. Robinson. Based on a novel by James M. Cain.

results.title: Double indemnity
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Joseph Sistrom and Billy Wilder
results.brief_description: Double Indemnity is possibly the definitive film noir. It features a sharp, literate screenplay with great dialogue (Raymond Chandler worked on the script), a stylish, cool and erotic mise-en-scene by director Billy Wilder, and a stunning performance by Barbara Stanwyck who, in this film, is queen of the femme fatales. She plays a bewitching ice-princess who seduces a crooked insurance agent (Fred MacMurray) into helping her kill her husband to cash in on his insurance policy. This malevolant, spell-binding thriller is based on James M. Cain’s classic pulp novel. Cast also includes Edward G. Robinson.

results.title: Double happiness
results.creator_credit: First Generation Films, New Views Films, Rose Waddell, Stephen Hegyes and Mina Shum
results.brief_description: Jade Li is an aspiring actress of Chinese descent living in Canada with her parents and young sister. She suffers under the strict rules of her traditional mother and father, aware of the pain caused them by her estranged brother. Jade has to battle for meagre small parts in theatre and television, frequently turned down for either being too Chinese or not Chinese enough. Jade’s parents frequently set her up on blind dates with eligible Chinese men, assuming she will marry one. Jade however is living a double life - she rebels against the cultural expectations of her family and embarks upon a tentative affair with a Caucasian student, Mark. Caught between her personal desires and her family obligations, Jade has to determine her own sense of identity and fate. “Double happiness” is a film that remarks effectively upon the generation gap and perceptively depicts the struggle of both sides to understand the emotional needs of the other. The film employs an episodic structure and character-to-camera addresses, to create a consistently humorous and engaging narrative. As a drama about a first generation immigrant experience, “Double happiness” never strays into sentimentality or stereotype and remains a sensitive portrayal of a typically complex family. With occasional English subtitles.

results.title: Double deal
results.creator_credit: Rychemond Film, Brian Kavanagh and Lynn Barker
results.brief_description: The wife of a businessman is bored and sexually frustrated so she takes up with a drifter who involves her in various crimes including kidnapping and murder. Mystery thriller. Stars Angela Punch McGregor and Louis Jourdan.

results.title: Double concerto: a film about the pianist Roger Woodward
results.creator_credit: Abstract Productions, Endeavour Film Productions, Angela Catterns and Hugh Piper
results.brief_description: The star of “Double Concerto” is the brilliant Australian pianist Roger Woodward. His inspiration and fellow musician is the equally brilliant Polish violinist, Wanda Wilkomirska. Together they play the double concerto “Southern Cross”, a concerto written especially for them by Australia’s most internationally acclaimed composer, Barry Conyingham. The film follows Roger and Wanda in rehearsal, in concert and in rambling walks along the sea shores. They discuss their music, their politics and their personal lives.

results.title: Dottie gets spanked
results.brief_description: Todd Haynes’ black comedy is set in 1950s suburbia where the TV heroine Dottie reigns supreme. When a young boy gets his chance to meet his idol, the series of events he witnesses transforms his fantasy life. This is where childhood’s end begins.

results.title: Dots
results.brief_description: An experimental film in which both sound and visuals were created entirely by Norman McLaren drawing directly upon the film with ordinary pen and ink. The main title is in eight languages. Rereleased with multilingual titles in 1949.

results.title: Dot in space
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross Films and Yoram Gross
results.brief_description: Dot’s new adventure takes her into outer space. She decides to resue Whyka, a Russian dog who is circling the Earth in a broken satellite. Once Dot saves Whyka, her troubles really begin. Her spacehip, Atlanta, crashes onto a planet called Pie-Arr-Squared. The inhabitants, called Roundies, imprison Dot and Whyka with the “Squaries”, unfortunate beings who are not considered round enough!

results.title: Dot goes to Hollywood
results.brief_description: Dot sets out on a mighty adventure which takes her to the razzle dazzle of sparkling Hollywood. Once there she becomes a film star to raise money for her little friend Gumley the koala who needs an operation on her eyes. With the help of Hollywood stars, Dot wins a talent quest and is discovered by a famous director, she becomes what all Hollywood dreams are made of - a star.

results.title: Dot and the Whale
results.brief_description: Our heroine Dot and her friend Neptune the dolphin find a whale stranded on an Australian beach and discover that to save her they must first find the old and wise ruler of the sea, Moby Dick. Using animation on beautifully filmed underwater live action scenes, this entertaining family film traces the exciting adventures of Dot and Neptune as they search for Moby Dick.
